thebibliography:
\begin{thebibliography}{19}        %here 19 is the widest mark...
%-----Type it \bibitems it is marked]{how we call it}Authors, hep-th/...
%-----Citations are then made by \cite{how we call it} in text ------------
%-----\bibitem without [how it is denoted] is numbered 1,2,3....

\bibitem{paper2}
M.~Majumdar and A.~C.~Davis,
``Cosmological creation of D-branes and anti-D-branes,''
JHEP {\bf 0203}, 056 (2002)
[arXiv:hep-th/0202148]; see also: 
N.~T.~Jones, H.~Stoica and S.~H.~Tye,
``The production, spectrum and evolution of cosmic strings in brane  inflation,''
arXiv:hep-th/0303269; S.~Sarangi and S.~H.~Tye,
``Cosmic string production towards the end of brane inflation,''
Phys.\ Lett.\ B {\bf 536}, 185 (2002)
[arXiv:hep-th/0204074].


\bibitem{bv2}
S.~Alexander, R.~Brandenberger and D.~Easson, ``Brane gases in the
early universe,'' Phys.\ Rev.\ D {\bf 62}, 103509 (2000)
[hep-th/0005212]


\bibitem{bv1}
R.~Brandenberger and C.~Vafa, ``Superstrings In The Early Universe,''
Nucl.\ Phys.\ B {\bf 316}, 391 (1989).


\bibitem{sen}
For reviews see: A.~Sen, ``Non-Bps D-Branes In String Theory,''
Class.\ Quant.\ Grav.\ {\bf 17}, 1251 (2000), J.~H.~Schwarz, ``Non-BPS
D-brane systems,'' arXiv:hep-th/9908144, A.~Lerda and R.~Russo,
``Stable non-BPS states in string theory: A pedagogical review,''
Int.\ J.\ Mod.\ Phys.\ A {\bf 15}, 771 (2000) [arXiv:hep-th/9905006].


\bibitem{joebigbook}
See for example, J.~Polchinski, ``String Theory, Volume I," {\it
Cambridge:UK, University of Cambridge Press (1998)}, chapter 7.



\bibitem{angles}
M.~Berkooz, M.~R.~Douglas and R.~G.~Leigh, ``Branes intersecting at
angles,'' Nucl.\ Phys.\ B {\bf 480}, 265 (1996)
[arXiv:hep-th/9606139].


\bibitem{narain}
E.~Gava, K.~S.~Narain and M.~H.~Sarmadi, ``On the bound states of p-
and (p+2)-branes,'' Nucl.\ Phys.\ B {\bf 504}, 214 (1997)
[arXiv:hep-th/9704006].

\bibitem{susskind}
T.~Banks and L.~Susskind, ``Brane - Antibrane Forces,''
hep-th/9511194.

\bibitem{paper3}
C.~P.~Burgess, M.~Majumdar, D.~Nolte, F.~Quevedo, G.~Rajesh and
R.~J.~Zhang, ``The inflationary brane-antibrane universe,'' JHEP {\bf
0107}, 047 (2001) [hep-th/0105204];


\bibitem{lifschytz}
G.~Lifschytz, ``Comparing D-branes to Black-branes,'' Phys.\ Lett.\ B
{\bf 388}, 720 (1996) [hep-th/9604156].

\bibitem{periwal}
V.~Periwal and R.~von Unge, ``Accelerating D-branes,'' Phys.\ Lett.\ B
{\bf 430}, 71 (1998) [arXiv:hep-th/9801121].


\bibitem{preskill}
J.~P.~Preskill, ``Cosmological Production Of Superheavy Magnetic

\bibitem{zelda}
Y.~B.~Zeldovich and M.~Y.~Khlopov, ``On The Concentration Of Relic

\bibitem{shellard}
See for example: E.~P.~Shellard, A.~Vilenkin, ``Cosmic Strings and
Other Topological Defects,'' {\it Cambridge, UK: University of
Cambridge Press (1994).}

\bibitem{bv3}
R.~Brandenberger, D.~A.~Easson and D.~Kimberly, ``Loitering phase in

\bibitem{abou}
M.~Abou-Zeid and M.~S.~Costa, ``Radiation from accelerated branes,''
Phys.\ Rev.\ D {\bf 61}, 106007 (2000) [arXiv:hep-th/9909148].



\bibitem{page}
D.~A.~Dicus, D.~N.~Page and V.~L.~Teplitz, ``Two And Three Body
Contributions To Cosmological Monopole Annihilation,'' Phys.\ Rev.\ D

\bibitem{landau}
 L. ~D. ~Landau, ~E. ~M. ~Lifshitz, ``The Classical Theory of
 Fields: Fourth Edition,'' Butterworth-Heinemann, NY (1997).

\bibitem{klebanov}
A.~Hashimoto and I.~R.~Klebanov, ``Scattering of strings from

I.~R.~Klebanov, ``Decay of Excited D-branes,'' Phys.\ Lett.\ B {\bf

L.~Thorlacius, ``The Size of p-Branes,'' Phys.\ Lett.\ B {\bf 371}, 51

\bibitem{garousi}
M.~R.~Garousi and R.~C.~Myers, ``Superstring Scattering from

\bibitem{gross}
D.~J.~Gross and J.~L.~Manes, ``The High-Energy Behavior Of Open String

\bibitem{peskin}
M.~E.~Peskin,~D.~V.~Schroeder, ``An Introduction to Quantum Field

\bibitem{kolb2}
T.~Goldman, E.~W.~Kolb and D.~Toussaint, ``Gravitational Clumping And

\bibitem{wadia}

\bibitem{maldareview}
C.~G.~Callan and J.~M.~Maldacena, ``Black holes in string theory,''
